thread.title: Wayne Rooney to China: Manchester United could still flog skipper this month despite transfer window closing
thread.title_full: Wayne Rooney to China: Manchester United could still flog skipper this month despite transfer window closing

author: jgordon
title: Wayne Rooney to China: Manchester United could still flog skipper this month despite transfer window closing
text:
ROO BETTER BELIEVE IT Wayne Rooney to China: Manchester United could still flog skipper this month despite transfer window closing 
Chinese Super League clubs have until February 28 to get their business done and England international is a high-priority target Gossip Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MANCHESTER UNITED skipper Wayne Rooney may be flogged to China this month despite the transfer window closing, according to reports. 
Chinese Super League clubs have until February 28 to get their business over the line meaning the England international is still in the shop window. Reuters 3 Jose Mourinho needs Wayne Rooney to give him options off the bench in a congested fixture list 
Jose Mourinho is keen to keep Rooney, 31, at least until the summer as United compete on four fronts. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But The Telegraph claims the striker – who is being used off the bench – could sway Old Trafford chiefs by showing interest in a move. Related Stories On the Wane Wayne Rooney will quit Manchester United if Jose Mourinho leaves him on bench, warns Paul Scholes Bolt from the Roo Usain Bolt wants to join Man Utd when he quits athletics and reckons he can replace Wayne Rooney DRIZZY DATES Coleen and Wayne Rooney enjoy a date night as they join Katie Piper at Drake concert in Manchester NIGHT AT THE ROOSEUM Wayne Rooney to be honoured with his own exhibition at the Manchester United museum 'YOU MUST DO WHAT HE WANTS' Wayne Rooney reveals how to get on with his Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho 
Landing the Three Lions captain would be the highest-profile signing in the league’s history and the commercial incentives are huge. 
Rooney – who has 18 months left on his £300,000-a-week contract – has not started a league game in 2017. PA:Press Association Rooney has not started a league game since mid-December after falling down the pecking order Getty Images 3 Bringing Rooney to China would be a huge coup for Chinese football 
Beijing Guoan have been linked with a second move for the former Everton star, with Guangzhou Evergrande Taobao also in the running. 
Rooney sat out of the Europa League win over St Etienne along with fellow veteran Michael Carrick. 
But it is believed the club’s all-time leading goalscorer is in contention to play against Blackburn in the FA Cup fifth round on Sunday. Wayne Rooney features in the new trailer for the forthcoming movie Logan
